^(exit_code)$.description: exit_code is sent only in the final message.

^(mime_type)$.description: This is only sent once in the first response containing stdout_data.
^(mime_type)$.title: mime_type is a detected MIME type of the stdout_data.

^(stderr_data)$.description: stderr_data contains bytes from stderr since the last response.

^(stdout_data)$.description: stdout_data contains bytes from stdout since the last response.

exitCode.description: exit_code is sent only in the final message.

mimeType.description: This is only sent once in the first response containing stdout_data.
mimeType.title: mime_type is a detected MIME type of the stdout_data.

pid.description: This is only sent once in an initial response for background processes.
pid.title: pid contains the process' PID.

stderrData.description: stderr_data contains bytes from stderr since the last response.

stdoutData.description: stdout_data contains bytes from stdout since the last response.

runme.stream.v1.Pong.jsonschema.json.description: Pong message for protocol-level keep-alive response
runme.stream.v1.Pong.jsonschema.json.title: Pong

runme.stream.v1.WebsocketResponse.jsonsc.description:
WebsocketResponse defines the message sent by the server over a websocket.
 The response is a union of types that indicate the type of message.

^(known_id)$.description: Optional Known ID to track the origin cell/block of the request.

^(run_id)$.description: Optional Run ID to track and resume execution.

knownId.description: Optional Known ID to track the origin cell/block of the request.

pong.description:
Protocol-level pong for frontend heartbeat. Once the server receives
 a ping, it will send a pong response with the exact same timestamp.
 This allows the frontend (client) to detect if the connection is
 still alive or stale/inactive. See WebsocketRequest's ping for more details.

runId.description: Optional Run ID to track and resume execution.

runme.stream.v1.WebsocketResponse.jsonsc.title: Websocket Response

runme.stream.v1.WebsocketStatus.jsonsche.description: Represents websocket-level status (e.g., for auth, protocol, or other errors).
runme.stream.v1.WebsocketStatus.jsonsche.title: Websocket Status
